New Records: Trent Boult claims career-best figures of 4/13.
Key Match Events: Trent Boult took 4 wickets for 13 runs.
Sri Lanka were reduced to 8 for 4 inside the powerplay.
Dasun Shanaka and Bhanuka Rajapaksa had a brief partnership but couldn't chase the target.
Pre-Game Insights: Fleming: Possibly the strongest squad New Zealand have ever had.
Moody: Don't be surprised by a surprise result today.
Fleming: Mitchell's inclusion not straightforward but makes sense.
Fleming: Mitchell Santner is like Daniel Vettori.
Tim Southee: On the day everyone poses different threats.
Nawaz: The middle order batters need to put their hands up.
Post-Match Reflections: NZ skipper Kane Williamson: The wicket was different to what we were expecting. Glenn Phillips and Daryll Mitchell put together a partnership, and it was an incredible knock to get a very good total.
SL skipper Dasun Shanaka: We started really well, particularly in the first 10 overs. But credit to Glenn Phillips who played an outstanding knock. Boult and Southee bowled really well up front.
Glenn Phillips: Me and Daryll were really clear we wanted to be as positive as possible. It's absolutely indescribable to score a century in a World Cup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch was described as 'tennis ball-ey' and variable.
New Zealand are well on their way to the semi-finals, barring something calamitous.
Sri Lanka need to win their remaining two games and hope other results go their way.
